definition: to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing

sentences.english: He even reconciled with a classmate with whom he had had trouble several years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至和一位積怨多年的同學言歸於好。

sentences.english: Can someone tell us why cos' we don't understand?
sentences.chinese: 告訴我積怨愈甚我們是爲了啥？

sentences.english: The petitioning system has long provided an outlet for rural grievances.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，上訪制度爲農村積怨提供了一個出口。

sentences.english: Talk therapy may be needed to unpack years of accumulated resentments.
sentences.chinese: 要解開多年積怨，可能還需要談話治療。

sentences.english: In some cases historic resentments are at the base.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情況下，歷史積怨埋下了禍根。
莫斯科的影響確實積怨甚深。

definition: to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to be greedy in getting money
(of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
